```{r functions}
graph.choropleth <- function(data, year){
  keep_cols = c(zip.name, sale.price.name)
  data(zip.regions)
  zip.prices <- data[, ..keep_cols]
  zip.prices <- zip.prices[, mean(get(sale.price.name), na.rm = TRUE), by = zip.name]
  colnames(zip.prices) <- c("region", "value")
  zip.prices$value <- as.numeric(zip.prices$value)
  zip.prices$region <- as.character(zip.prices$region)
  zip.prices <- zip.prices[region %in% zip.regions$region,]
  zip.prices <- zip.prices[value > 0,]
  
  plot.title <- c(year, " Average Sale Price by Zip Code")
  plot.title <- paste(plot.title, collapse="")
  
  choro.graph <- zip_choropleth(zip.prices,
                 zip_zoom = zip.prices$region,
                 title       =  plot.title,
                 legend      = "Average Sale Price")
  return (choro.graph)
}

avg.sale.price.by <- function(data, by.column.names){
  mean.price <- data[, .(`Avg. Price` = mean(get(sale.price.name), na.rm=TRUE)), by = by.column.names]
  return (mean.price)
}
```

Introduction
=====================================  

For our final project, we decided to analyze New York City real estate data between 2003 and 2017. The data is linked here: https://www1.nyc.gov/site/finance/taxes/property-annualized-sales-update.page

Click on the tabs to see different reports.

Time-Series 
=====================================

Row {data-width=800}
-------------------------------------

```{r line_graph}
inputPanel(
  selectInput(inputId="line_variable", label = "Select Variable to Color By:", choices = line.variables, selected = line.variables[1]),
  selectInput(inputId="line_building_class_type", label = "Select Building Class Type:", choices = first.letter.variables, selected = residential.codes, multiple = TRUE)
)
renderPlot({
  if (input$line_variable == building.class.first.letter){
    sub.dat <- dat[get(building.class.first.letter) %in% input$line_building_class_type,]
    mean.price <- avg.sale.price.by(sub.dat, c(sale.year.name, input$line_variable))
    setorderv(x = mean.price, cols = "Sale Year", order = 1)
    # mean.price <- mean.price %>% mutate(input$line_variable = forcats::fct_reorder2(input$line_variable, `Sale Year`, `Avg. Price`))
    
    price.plot <- ggplot(mean.price, aes(`Sale Year`, as.integer(`Avg. Price`), color = `Building Class First Letter`)) + 
                   geom_line(size = 1) + geom_point(aes(`Sale Year`,as.integer(`Avg. Price`))) +
                   xlab("Sale Year") + ylab("Avg. Price") + labs(color = "Building Class") +
                   scale_x_continuous(breaks = scales::pretty_breaks(length(unique(mean.price$`Sale Year`)))) +
                   ggtitle("NYC Avg. Residential Real Estate Price by Building Class & Year") 
    price.plot
  }
  else{
    sub.dat <- dat
    mean.price <- avg.sale.price.by(sub.dat, c(sale.year.name, input$line_variable))
    setorderv(x = mean.price, cols = "Sale Year", order = 1)
    # mean.price <- mean.price %>% mutate(input$line_variable = forcats::fct_reorder2(input$line_variable, `Sale Year`, `Avg. Price`))
    
    price.plot <- ggplot(mean.price, aes(`Sale Year`, as.integer(`Avg. Price`), color = `Fixed Borough`)) + 
                   geom_line(size = 1) + geom_point(aes(`Sale Year`,as.integer(`Avg. Price`))) +
                   xlab("Sale Year") + ylab("Avg. Price") + labs(color = "Borough") +
                   scale_x_continuous(breaks = scales::pretty_breaks(length(unique(mean.price$`Sale Year`)))) +
                   ggtitle("NYC Avg. Residential Real Estate Price by Borough & Year") 
    price.plot
  }
})
```

Plot of number of sales in each borough
===================================


Row {data-height=500}
-------------------------------------

```{r respondents}
inputPanel(
  selectInput(inputId = "input_year", label = "Select Year:", 
              choices = c(sale_year, 'All'), selected = 'All')
)
renderPlot({
  
  a <- matrix(0, nrow = 5, ncol = 2)
  colnames(a) <- c('borough', 'number')
  a <- as.data.frame(a)
  a[, 1] <- borough_name
  
  if (input$input_year == 'All'){
    for (i in 1:5){
     sub <- all.data[all.data$BOROUGH == i, ]
     a[i, 2] <- nrow(sub)
    }
    number_borough <- ggplot(data = a, aes(x = borough, y = number)) +
      geom_bar(stat="identity", width=0.5) + 
      xlab('Borough')
    return(number_borough)
  }else{
    for (i in 1:5){
       sub <- all.data[all.data$BOROUGH == i & all.data$`SALE YEAR` == input$input_year, ]
       a[i, 2] <- nrow(sub)
    }
    number_borough <- ggplot(data = a, aes(x = borough, y = number)) +
      geom_bar(stat = "identity", width = 0.5) + 
      xlab('Borough')
    return(number_borough)
  }
  
})
```

Plot of number of sales in each year
===================================


Row {data-height=500}
-------------------------------------

```{r}
inputPanel(
  selectInput(inputId = "input_borough", label = "Select Borough:", 
              choices = c(borough_name, 'All'), selected = 'All')
)
renderPlot({
  
  b <- matrix(0, nrow = length(sale_year), ncol = 2)
  b <- as.data.frame(b)
  colnames(b) <- c('sale year', 'number')
  b$`sale year` <- sale_year
  
  if (input$input_borough == 'All'){
    for (i in 1:length(sale_year)){
      sub <- all.data[all.data$`SALE YEAR` == sale_year[i], ]
      b[i, 2] <- nrow(sub)
    }
    number_year <- ggplot(data = b, aes(x = `sale year`, y = number, group=1)) +
      geom_line() + 
      xlab('Year')
    return(number_year)
  }else{
    for (i in 1:length(sale_year)){
      sub <- all.data[all.data$`SALE YEAR` == sale_year[i] & all.data$BOROUGH == which(input$input_borough == borough_name), ]
      b[i, 2] <- nrow(sub)
    }
    number_year <- ggplot(data = b, aes(x = `sale year`, y = number, group=1)) +
      geom_line() + 
      xlab('Year')
    return(number_year)
  }
  
})
```

Plot considering units and square feet

```{r}
inputPanel(
  selectInput(inputId = "units_sf_group", label = "Type of units or square feet", choices = c(residential.group.name, commercial.group.name, total.units.group.name, land.group.name, gross.group.name), selected = total.units.group.name),
  selectInput(inputId = "num_price", label = "Choose to show number of cases or the price", choices = c("Number of cases", "Price"), selected = "Number of cases")
)

renderPlot({
  if (input$num_price == "Number of cases") {
    Num <- all.data[, .N, by = get(input$units_sf_group)]
    ggplot(data = Num, mapping = aes(x = get(input$np_us_group), y = N)) +
      geom_bar(stat = "identity", color = "blue", fill = "#99CCFF") +
      labs(x = sprintf("Group of %", get(input$units_sf_group)), y = "Number of Cases in each Group") +
      theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1))
  }
  else {
    ggplot(data = all.data, aes(x = get(input$units_sf_group), y = get(log.price.name))) +
      geom_boxplot() +
      labs(title = sprintf("Logarithm of NYC Real Estate Price by %", get(input$units_sf_group)), x = sprintf("Group of %", get(input$units_sf_group)), y = "Log Sale Price") +
      theme(axis.text.x = element_text(angle = 45, hjust = 1))
  }
})
```
